#labels Phase-Implementation
=JavaRosa and FeedSync Server Demo=
This demo depicts how a mobile application can to sync data with an opaque FeedSync server.

==Environment Configuration==
For this demo 2 Eclipse instances are required.

 * Feed sync server workspace:
  # Configure one eclipse with Mesh4x importing projects from SVN: 
   * http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/Mesh4j/trunk
   * http://mesh4x.googlecode.com/svn/Mesh4j/spikes/Mesh4jWebApp
  # Create a tomcat server
  # Add MeshjWebApp to the tomcat server
  # Start the server
  # check that the following urls are working:
     * http://localhost:8080/mesh4x/
     * http://localhost:8080/mesh4x/feeds
     * http://localhost:8080/mesh4x/feeds/XForms
     * http://localhost:8080/mesh4x/feeds/XFormDemo1
     * http://localhost:8080/mesh4x/feeds/XFormDemo2va

 * Java Rosa workspace:
  # Configure one Eclipse instance with JavaRosa environment
  # Import projects from SVN: http://code.dimagi.com/svn/JavaRosa/branches/dev-instedd/
  # Change the url of the feed sync server
    * Open class org.javarosa.demo.shell.JavaRosaDemoShell
    * Search method loadProperties()
    * Change the server in both url, change "vcc-pc" for you machine name (localhost does not work with SUN's emulator):
       * initProperty(Mesh4jPropertyRules.HTTP_SYNC_BASE_URL, "http://vcc-pc:8080/mesh4x/feeds/", true);
       * initProperty(Mesh4jPropertyRules.HTTP_DISCOVERY_XFORMS_URL, "http://vcc-pc:8080/mesh4x/feeds/XForms", true);
  # Start the JavaRosa midlet demo running with ANT the file build.xml of the project org.javarosa.demo

==Demo Step by Step==
 # Set focus on the mobile phone emulator.
 # Open the JavaRosa menu and choose the option 'Sync - Import Def - HTTP', this imports all available forms from the FeedSync server. New forms are automatically available in the form list.
 # Select the XFormDemo2 element form the forms list.
 # Open the JavaRosa menu and choose the option 'Sync Data - HTTP', this imports all data from the FeedSync server.

For more details you may want to read the following blog entry [http://jtondato.clariusconsulting.net/2008/10/javarosa-midp-demo.html JavaRosa MIDP Demo]
